H0.text: The division of cells in the plant is the process directly responsible for the growth of leaves as a corn plant ages.

H1.text: The release of oxygen from the plant is the process directly responsible for the growth of leaves as a corn plant ages.

H2.text: The absorption of carbon dioxide in the stem is the process directly responsible for the growth of leaves as a corn plant ages.

H3.text: The transportation of nutrients from the roots is the process directly responsible for the growth of leaves as a corn plant ages.

A4.text: After growth from the zygote to the adult, cell division by mitosis allows for continual construction and repair of the organism.
